Description: Painted calcite shabti of Tamery with a blue lappet-wig, black and orange facial features, uncrossed yellow arms traced in black, the front of the legs is decorated with two black lines running to the foot with orange and black toes, the back is decorated with a yellow and black representation of a seed-basket, the back of the legs is inscribed with black painted Hieroglyphs.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
